001package org.biopax.validator.api;
002
003
004import java.io.PrintWriter;
005import java.io.StringWriter;
006
007import javax.xml.stream.XMLStreamException;
008
009import org.apache.commons.logging.Log;
010import org.apache.commons.logging.LogFactory;
011
012/**
013 * Basic class for the framework classes 
014 * that use AOP (and LTW) to check BioPAX
015 * and report errors.
016 *
017 * @author rodche
018 */
019public abstract class AbstractAspect {
020        private static final Log log = LogFactory.getLog(AbstractAspect.class);
021
022        /**
023         * BioPAX Validator instance
024         */
025        protected Validator validator;
026
027        /**
028         * Registers the error in the validator.
029         *
030         * @param object a model element or parser/reader (e.g., InputStream) associated with the issue
031         * @param errorCode error code
032         * @param reportedBy validation rule class name
033         * @param setFixed whether the problem was auto-fixed or not
034         * @param msgArgs additional error message parameters
035         */
036        public void report(Object object, String errorCode, String reportedBy, boolean setFixed, Object... msgArgs)
037        {
038                validator.report(object, errorCode, reportedBy, setFixed, msgArgs);
039        }
040
041
042        /**
043         * Registers other (external) exceptions.
044         *
045         * The exception class, i.e., simple name in lower case, 
046         * is used as the error code, and the 'object' is to
047         * find the corresponding validation result where this 
048         * problem should be added.
049         *
050         * This must be public method (for unclear reason, otherwise causes an AOP exception...)
051         *
052         * @param t the exception
053         * @param obj model, element, or another related to the BioPAX data object
054         * @param errorCode validator error code
055         * @param reportedBy validator rule name
056         * @param details extra message to be added at the end of the original error message if not null
057         */
058        public void reportException(Throwable t, Object obj, String errorCode, String reportedBy, String details) {
059
060                StringBuilder msg = new StringBuilder(t.toString());
061
062                if(t instanceof XMLStreamException) {
063                        XMLStreamException ex = (XMLStreamException) t;
064                        msg.append("; ").append(ex.getLocation().toString());
065                }
066                else {
067                        if("exception".equals(errorCode)) //catch a bug
068                                msg.append(" - stack:").append(getStackTrace(t)).append(" - ");
069                }
070
071                if(details != null)
072                        msg.append("; ").append(details);
073
074                if (validator != null) {
075                        validator.report(obj, errorCode, reportedBy, false, msg.toString());
076                } else {
077                        log.error("validator is null; skipping " +
078                                "an intercepted 'syntax.error': " + msg + " reported by: " + reportedBy);
079                }
080        }
081
082        private static String getStackTrace(Throwable aThrowable) {
083                StringWriter strw = new StringWriter();
084                PrintWriter printWriter = new PrintWriter(strw);
085                aThrowable.printStackTrace(printWriter);
086                return strw.toString();
087        }
088
089        public Validator getValidator() {
090                return validator;
091        }
092
093        public abstract void setValidator(Validator biopaxValidator);
094}
